trends: There have been 6 other sightings in Waukesha
There were no other sightings in Waukesha on or around March 11th 2010
divs: sighting detailsbasically just wanting to mention that i and several others have seen lights in or around the fox river area of waukesha (se wisconsin) on an off since last april, including a sighting at around 3:00am by myself and my husband. the most recent of these sightings have been in the past week or two. these are basically lights in a circular shape that appear significantly lower in the visual horizon than the "stars of the night sky". they are also larger in size (about x5 to x10) than a bright star on a clear night (visual perspective). they appear either instantaneously or "fade" into view. usually they appear as a single instance, though on one occasion two were witnessed in close proximity to one another. for the most part they simply seem to hoover - though their light seems to pulse and change color (mostly orange-ish). however, eventually the do move - and the movement is barely perceptible - but quite odd - the seem to move in a up and down or side to side pattern. and in the case of the two being sighted together, one of the "balls of light" seemed to "zip off" directly to the east (right) of its hoovering counterpart at an extreme speed. for the most part they seem to move off quite slowly (fade from view) or simply "blink out" instantaneously (disappear) we've tried to capture photos, but lack the appropriate equipment (our cellphones is about it for cameras). we've also talked to quite a few people in the vicinity of the park and river who've also noticed these orbs or spheres recently too. i think the thing that causes a person to notice them is that they are so much larger and lower than the stars, and their strange behavior\movements and color shifting. (2 comments - 1 - this form is way too cumbersome. get someone in your group who has familiarity with designing ui or hi to make the form much more user friendly and you'll probably get a lot more reporting. 2 - allow a default form set to be defined for anonymous posters. some ppl will be glad to report such phenomena provided they can automatically do so with ease and without fear of public ridicule. when we saw the first occurrence last year, i looked up "where to post ufo sightings" and found your site. however, one look at your form and i opted not to.) the only reason i am taking the time to make this report now, is these "spheres" or "orbs" myself and a number of my neighbors are seeing in the waukesha wisconsin area are strikingly familiar to those currently being seen\looked into near lake erie. i'm sure there are a number of ppl in the area who could substantiate similar sightings (i've talked to at least 20 dif ppl who have seen these things), but they'd probably only do so if they were assured their names would be omitted and they'd not be "on camera" in any way. though i remain largely skeptical on the topic of ufo's as a whole, these are definitely odd occurrences and they are reoccurring. though to be honest, i don't have the time to be camped out looking at the night sky all the time, so how often or if there's any pattern to their appearances i couldn't tell you. i know they seem to be showing up a great deal the past week or so.
